data.title: I would expect tab area to shrink when tabCloseButton: "off"
data.body:
Refs #18771

1. "workbench.editor.tabCloseButton": "off"
2. Tab area still leaves an empty space in the right for the close button even though I just disabled it
3. I would expect the tab area to shrink as I believe that is the primary motive for hiding the clsoe button - to save space!

I know that you keep that space to show when a file is dirty, but if a file gets dirty the tab area should grow automatically imho

data.title: Why does Configure language specific settings open the settings.json file and not the new settings editor
data.body:
Test: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19060

Title says it all :-)

data.title: Right click on tab close button immediatly closes the tab
data.body:
Refs: #18771

1. showTabs
2. right click on the tab X button. The tab is immediatly closed on mouse down
3. I would expect the context menu to be shown as is in all editors

data.title: Change the command behind Open Settings to Open User Settings
data.body:
The label should still be `Settings`, but the command should run the old open user settings.

Otherwise the `workbench.settings.openDefaultSettings` setting is broken.

We can just have 2 commands as before: user & workspace.

data.title: Not getting screen reader feedback as I am filtering through settings
data.body:
1. Type in the settings input search field
2. Screen reader is silent
3. When I am done typeing I would expect the number of results as feedback read out

data.title: 'reindent all lines' removes leading space in comment
data.body:
Testing #19091:
In a typescript file:
```typescript file
/*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 *  Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
 *  Licensed under the MIT License. See License.txt in the project root for license information.
 *--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/

'use strict';
class A {
}
```
- use the 'Reindent all lines' command
- check out the file comment. The space before '*' has been removed
```
/*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*  Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
*  Licensed under the MIT License. See License.txt in the project root for license information.
*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
```

data.title: Broken permissions of an extensions install folder can lock up uninstallation of all other extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.9.0-insider 61a56dbf6e80b6732381349e4654e3ae5f0710f4
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

Updated Steps to Reproduce:

1. Look for an extension that has an update available
2. Change the permissions of the extensions directory so that it is no longer writable (e.g. `sudo chown -R root ~/.vscode/extensions/extension-identifier-x.x.x`
3. Click the button to update the extension

From there on, GUI-Buttons for uninstalling **any** extension do no longer work, failing silently with the following output in the developer console:

data.title: 'reindent all lines' and formatter have different formatting strategies
Inserting language sepcific setting uses unusal formatting
data.body:
Test: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19060

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Insert a markdown specific language setting
2. My settings file looks like this afterwards:
```json
{
	"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary",
	"editor.tabSize": 4,
	"editor.insertSpaces": false,
	"files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
	"files.autoSaveDelay": 1000,
	"explorer.openEditors.visible": 0,
	"tslint.enable": false,
	// "editor.fontFamily": "helvetica",
	"editor.fontFamily": "hack",
	"editor.fontLigatures": false,
	"editor.fontSize": 13,
	"editor.folding": false,
	"workbench.settings.openDefaultSettings": false,
	"workbench.editor.showTabs": true,
	"workbench.editor.enablePreview": false,
	"workbench.editor.enablePreviewFromQuickOpen": false,
	"editor.snippetSuggestions": "bottom",
	"typescript.check.tscVersion": false,
	"git.confirmSync": false,
	"window.zoomLevel": 0,
	"security.workspacesTrustedToSpecifyExecutables": {
		"P:\\mseng\\VSCode\\vscode": true
	}
,
"[markdown]": {
		
	}
}```

Would have expected:

```json
{
	"editor.renderWhitespace": "boundary",
	"editor.tabSize": 4,
	"editor.insertSpaces": false,
	"files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
	"files.autoSaveDelay": 1000,
	"explorer.openEditors.visible": 0,
	"tslint.enable": false,
	// "editor.fontFamily": "helvetica",
	"editor.fontFamily": "hack",
	"editor.fontLigatures": false,
	"editor.fontSize": 13,
	"editor.folding": false,
	"workbench.settings.openDefaultSettings": false,
	"workbench.editor.showTabs": true,
	"workbench.editor.enablePreview": false,
	"workbench.editor.enablePreviewFromQuickOpen": false,
	"editor.snippetSuggestions": "bottom",
	"typescript.check.tscVersion": false,
	"git.confirmSync": false,
	"window.zoomLevel": 0,
	"security.workspacesTrustedToSpecifyExecutables": {
		"P:\\mseng\\VSCode\\vscode": true
	},
	"[markdown]": {
		
	}
}
```

@sandy081 FYI.

data.title: Test: output scroll lock
data.body:
- [x] any os @joaomoreno 
- [x] any os @egamma 

Complexity: 1 

We have added an action in the output title area to lock the output scrolling. Verify when this action is enabled output will not automatically scroll.
More details #18768

data.title: Unhelpful description of 'hotExit' setting values
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.x
- OS Version: macOS

The descriptions of the three value "off", "onExit", "onExitAndWindowClose" are identical and sound rather awkward: "Whether hot exit is enabled...".

![2017-01-24_11-12-06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22243139/54977c6a-e226-11e6-8cdd-98d0306ae16b.png)

Why not use a similar wording as all the other multi valued settings: "Controls whether unsaved files are remembered."

data.title: Inserted user settings badly indented
data.body:
Ref #18316

1. View > Toggle Render Whitespace
2. Open settings.json and notice that the added settings are badly indented

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 11 09 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22242983/bf0a8c14-e225-11e6-907d-c94796d1f31f.png)

data.title: Cannot open settings in non-folder mode
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.x
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create new window
2. open settings

Observe:
![2017-01-24_11-09-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22242940/99fe357e-e225-11e6-8b32-cb7641b1ef45.png)

data.title: Auto wrapping too much when using non-monospace font
Synchronized scrolling should follow selection.active and not selection.start
data.body:
Testing #19082

`selection.active` is where the cursor is

* make a multiline selection going up: in this case selection.start == selection.active. The preview is correctly synchronized with the editor's cursor.
* make a multiline selection going down: in this case selection.end == selection.active. The preview is not scrolling.

![selection-active](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22242666/8273db80-e224-11e6-9f24-c2988bb2ea39.gif)

data.title: panel switcher and high contrast
data.body: re #18769 * open panels * use high contrast mode * 🐛 for editor tabs and the activity bar we use an orange outline for the active element. The panel switcher misses that

data.title: Selecting in the markdown preview with the mouse should set the selection in the .md editor
data.body:
Testing #19082

I would expect that double clicking a word or selecting some words in the markdown preview would:
1. Select the corresponding .md source range
2. Reveal the range

![editor-selection-not-set](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22242241/e13d4f0e-e222-11e6-8a96-906704a7e3b2.gif)

data.title: Launches are not shown
data.body:
- Make sure that you have some programs to launch in your launch.json
- Go to Debug view
- There are no launches

data.title: No scrollbar visible in the Markdown preview when having a vertical editor layout
data.body:
Testing  #19082

There is no vertical scrollbar in the Markdown preview

![no-scrollbar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22241946/c55802b2-e221-11e6-8506-5a513c6361d9.gif)

data.title: format broken
data.body:
My computer was frozen and I forced to quit.
Then TypeScript format no longer works well.
What should I do

data.title: Annotate provider interfaces with best practices
data.body:
For example describe what the expectations are for "symbol location": is it supposed to point to the name of a function, its signature or the entire implementation? Should hover provider's result be a function signature, its docstring or something entirely different?

Currently we rely on reverse-engineering extensions that ship with vscode itself.

data.title: Editor viewport should not jump around when typing
data.body:
Testing #19082 

* Set up a markdown file side-by-side with its preview
* Go to a certain location in the editor
* Press Enter
> Notice: The editor viewport jumps around.

![jumpy-editor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22241718/e16e94b2-e220-11e6-9737-9ccb1e9aa264.gif)

data.title: window.openFilesInNewWindow  not working as excpected
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18609

- VSCode Version: 1.9 insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

See screen cast. I would have expected to see the file opened in the new window. 

![cast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/22241666/a476e6d6-e220-11e6-947f-977b4b81bf38.gif)

In addition I think it is not clear what should happen if the setting is on and a file from the same workspace is opened with File > New. Should it open in a new window or in the existing one.

data.title: Existing launch.json not recognized
data.body:
Version 1.9.0-insider
Commit 61a56dbf6e80b6732381349e4654e3ae5f0710f4
Date 2017-01-24T08:05:06.845Z

- clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice.git
- open workspace, go to the debug viewlet

The config drop down says: 'No configurations', not recognizing the existing Node launch config.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/22241501/e809e444-e21f-11e6-9abc-6f8b6a37511a.png)

data.title: "window.openFilesInNewWindow" why default and off
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18609

The document says for default and off that it will open in the last active window. Why do we have two settings then.

data.title: cannot open settings
data.body:
on a fresh insiders install on a fresh VM (windows 8), *without* having a folder open, I see this:

![jan-24-2017 10-26-50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/22241454/b47265fc-e21f-11e6-9eb8-712c3eb24abb.gif)

```

data.title: Can't open settings in current insiders build
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider 61a56dbf6e80b6732381349e4654e3ae5f0710f4
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Code (Either normal or via code-insiders --disable-extensions)
2. Open Settings (via menu or shortcut)

I tried to open the settings today and now get the following error message:
 
`Unable to open 'settings.json': Cannot read property 'filterPreferences' of undefined.`

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 10 10 24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7542/22240901/58bb09fa-e21d-11e6-9875-523f40dbbfe6.png)

Emptying or deleting the settings.json file doesn't change anything.

data.title: KeyBoard binding to last edited cursor Feature Request

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Best if last edited location key board binding is available in visual studio code. The same was eclipse has <kbd>Ctrl + q</kbd>.

data.title: Revisit TypeImplementation and TypeImplementationProvider names
data.body: After confusion about what this feature is supposed to do we seemingly landed on 'go to implementation'. Internally and in the API we talk about 'TypeImplementationProvider' which I would like to revisit. My proposal is to just call it `ImplementationProvider` similar to how we call it `ReferenceProvider` and not TypeReferenceProvider

data.title: git reset -p : Reset line per line (and maybe per block too)
data.body:
it would be super nice to have the equivalent of `git reset -p`.

We can add and remove selectively what we want to be in staging or not, but I haven't find an option to reset lines/blocks.

Thanks for VSC, it's awesome :heart: !
